awkward.translation[0].definitions[0].de: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say
awkward.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions.
There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=made it difficult for her to know what to do).
awkward.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: She liked to dance but felt awkward if someone was watching her.
Make sure that the baby is not sleeping in an awkward position.
awkward.translation[0].definitions[2].de: difficult to do, use, or deal with
awkward.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: It’ll be awkward getting cars in and out.
The new financial arrangements were awkward to manage.
A good carpenter can make a cupboard to fit the most awkward space.
She was afraid he was going to ask an awkward question.
awkward.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I’m sorry to call at such an awkward time but I won’t keep you a minute.
awkward.translation[0].definitions[4].de: an awkward person is deliberately unhelpful
awkward.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: an awkward customer (=person who is difficult and unhelpful)
The staff wanted to go home and they were getting awkward about a meeting starting so late.
